posts.content:
New to the board - never played multiplayer, just OC/Expansions/Premiums and some mods on the vault. Found this board via Google.

Anyway - love monks, can't deny the power of clerics, figured out that wisdom synergy would make an almost unbeatable character (uh, yeah, I'm about 10 years late on recognizing that). Built a monk/cleric and took him through OC and HOTU - he encountered very few problems and once he got the Harm spell, it was over for bosses/dragons/liches - harm and a quick fist/enhanced kama reduced foes to rubbish. I rarely plan builds much beyond wanting to max certain feats and I kind of just pick feats as I go along. I don't even track my changes as I advance. I'm submitting this build in hopes that you all can tell me how to do it better and what to aim for by level 40.

Monk (1)/Cleric (27)

STR - 14
DEX - 14
CON - 12
INT - 10
WIS - 14 (21)
CHA - 14

I just pump WIS, obviously.

Domains: Air/Sun - took Air because I wanted Call/Chain Lightning as offensive spells, plus wanted Turn Elemental (the elementals in Castle Jhareg were always a nuisance to me) and took Sun because of undead in Beggar's Nest and under Punkin's house.

Feats: All Armor (I wear monk gear), Armor Skin, Cleave, Dodge, Epic Prowess, Epic Spell Penetration, EWF (unarmed), Evasion, Extend Spell, Extra Stunning, Extra Turning, Flurry, GSP, IC (unarmed), IUS, Luck of Heroes, Monk AC, Mount, Shield, Stun, WF (unarmed), Monk/Simple Weapons.

No dual welding (I wanted him to go unarmed throughout a la sacred fist, but couldn't turn down putting Haste on kama (and the other goodies) in the forge in HOTU.

Skills:

Concentration: 30
Persuade: 30
Spellcraft: 30
Tumble: 5

Currently level 28: I started with Monk at Level 1 and did all Cleric after that.

My basic strategy is to use all the cleric buffs (all the useful ones are extended - bull's/owl's/battletide/divine power/divine favor/death ward/magic vestment/holy aura), plus spell resistance, drink a potion of cat's grace, then melee as a monk, sometimes using spells to "soften up" tough opponents. I rarely use henchmen.

I welcome your input.

Also - can someone suggest vault modules to get him to level 40?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I can easily aswer that last question: The Sands of Fate series will take your post-HotU character all the way to level 40.

And I can tell ya in all honesty that you kinda lost a BAB point needlessly for absolutely no reason. Your starting stats are bad, making him much weaker than he could be. You don't have ANY tumble whatsoever and you have 30 Persuade. In terms of powerbuilding, well, you're simply not powerbuilding. If you are going to be a caster Cleric, then you're better off using the Zen Archery feat, because that makes your casting stat also your attacking stat. Taking feats such as , Called Shot, Rapid Shot and Point Blank shot while using a Longbow (will need Martial Weapons Proficiency for that) is your best bet and whatever you can't cast to death, you'll be able to kill in ranged combat. I have a Cleric guide in this guild that will probably make you want to reconsider the way you've built this toon and also a build that is very very similar to yours, but with a more clear focus. 1- A Complete Guide to the Basics of Character Building: this guide will help you with some basic concepts of building that can be applied while using pretty much any class combo:

http://nwnecbguild.44.forumer.com/a-com ... 15440.html

2- An Insight into the Cleric Class: This is a guide that will discuss the Cleric class in depth, and later on (some 5 posts after the main one) I also discuss the Cleric / Monk combo, which IMO is THE BEST COMBO IN THE GAME:

http://nwnecbguild.44.forumer.com/an-in ... 15461.html

3- The Demolition Man: this is a build of mine that uses Cleric the way I described above, but much more effectively than you here, because it has MUCH HIGHER starting Wisdom score, plus it focuses on both spell DCs (which makes it that much harder for mobs to succeed their saving throws against your spells (meaning you kill more frequently with instant death spells and anything else you decide to use). In regular campaigns, the monster saves and stats in general aren't at all competitive, so you can really be fooled by the fact that your build is doing so well there. I remember once I built a Ranger / Weapon Master who used to dual-wield rapiers and he cruised through HoTU. And just in case you're wondering, dual-wielding Rapiers is a very bad option because of the penalty involved. Take a look at it so you can begin to understand what Character Building is about.

http://nwnecbguild.44.forumer.com/demol ... 15420.html

Welcome to a new world of class combos and powergaming, my friend. As you will hopefully learn if you stick with us for long enough, Neverwinter Nights is THE MOST COMPLEX AND CUSTOMIZABLE GAME in terms of character buildings. There are 23 classes, and 40 levels through which you can distribute any amount of levels of three different classes, plus six starting stats and 10 stat increases from 1 to 40, plus feats, requirements, epic feats, and combos that you never thought possible up until now. If you're one of those people (like myself) who love games where actually knowing more, being a better player actually makes a difference, then NWN is the best game you'll ever find. I have been playing this game for 10 years, and there's still so much that I don't know!

Take it EZ!

Another approach would be to get Pretty Good Char Creator, a module that lets you set up and customize a character. You can ask the Set-up Helper (or whatever her name is) to reset all your levels, and she will reset your level to 1, but you keep your experience, so you can re-do all the leveling. You cannot re-do what you did when creating your level 1 character, so this build does the best I can do to turn that into a watered-down version of Max's Demolition Man. Because 2 feats were wasted at level 1 with Dodge and Luck of Heroes, and the lower INT means no skill points for UMD, I decided to throw in some Fighter to replace the lost feats. I even managed to squeeze in Extend Spell. The result is definitely not as goos as Demolition Man, but it should be good enough. Remember to save your character after rebuilding him. One more thing, use the item maker guy to make a bow like you would have had Risolvr make on his forge, and make a kama with acid damage, because there are some monsters in Sands of Fate that can only be killed with acid damage.

If you want to make an unarmed monk, you need at least 16 levels of monk to get the maximum unarmed damage. A level 1 Monk will do 1d6 damage, while a level 16 Monk will do 1d20 damage. Also, some of the buffs, like Dark Fire, will work on a weapon and not monk gloves, and Risolvr's forge can't do anything for monk gloves. Tne Aielund Saga is great for a STR-based unarmed Monk but it starts at level 1.

I'm not sure, but I think the Aribeth's Redemption series is supposed to be played after the OC, not after HotU. If so, a character who has finished HotU will have too high a level and the game will be too easy to be fun.

To be honest, I prefer Cleric Monks to pretty much anything you can suggest, but I can understand the theoretical power of a STR based monk. His AC will suffer greatly, of course, so you will need many Heal potions or a Cleric Henchman to heal you. I wouldn't recommend a Monk RDD to focus on Monk, except perhaps for the speed bonus, so I would go Monk 10 Sorcerer 20 RDD 10, losing a couple of BAB points by going Monk 8 RDD 10 Sorcerer 2 pre-epic. that way you'd have a full arcane spellbook, while losing some movespeed and unarmed damage (but gaining Time Stop for instance, which is invaluable)

But what the OP is requesting is a Cleric Monk, and the advantage of that combo is that it will have equivalent damage to this toon you posted, thanks to divine buffs like GMW, Divine Power, Divine Favor, Darkfire, Prayer and Battletide, while having a truly spectacular AC (Wis and Dex gear and buffs + robes, Monk boots and whatnot). I remember my Magical Master toon went through the ENTIRE Ironlord army of golems in chapter 3 of The Aielund Saga without quaffing a SINGLE HEAL potion. He simply wouldn't get hit! By the time the army reached the Keep, there was only the giant golem and the Ironlord himself left to kill. I even had to teleport to the capital city before the battle to drop my henchmen cuz they kept getting killed, which made me have to reload a couple of times. If you haven't had the chance of playing any toon with this class combo, you really gotta do it to feel the power!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: In order to take maximum advantage of a certain item you get in Chapter 4 Part 3, you must be a STR-based unarmed Monk, which is why I played this build. The +4 AC from RDD partially compensates for the loss of AC from not being DEX-based. Also, I enjoy being unarmed and unarmored and still kicking butt.

posts.content: Your STR determines the DC of Dev Crit. A DEX-based character would benefit from the attack bonus and damage bonus (I think it has both), but the Dev Crit would have an unusually low DC, so it would almost never take effect.

Dumb question: dual wield Monk(1)/Cleric(29).

When I cast Divine Power, do I get 10 attacks per round when hasted and using flurry?

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Yes, but only the main hand attacks follow the Monk progression, so for instance if your AB is 61, your schedule will be:

Main Hand: 61/58/55/52/49
Off-Hand: 61/56
Extra Attacks: 61 (Divine Power)/56 (Flurry of Blows)/51 (Haste) (not necessarily in that order)
